page.title: 02THE RIVER WORFE
page.content: The river flows across the area from N-SW and starts as three brooks,the Ruckley Brook,Neachley Brook and the Albrighton Brook which join in the middle of the area to form the River Worfe.The Worfe then flows SW until it joins the River Severn at Bridgnorth. The Worfe flows across soft New Red Sandstone which acts as an aquafier as well as allowing the brooks and river to cut quite deep steep sided valleys. Onthe Hatton Grange estate it forms a steep narrow rocky gorge which has had a number of dams built across it to provide a succession of ornamental pools.At the junction of the three brooks carts and carriages had to ford the river. Above the confluence a 5 acre pool was emptied by the R.A.F in 1940 and in 1962 when the dam burst.Pools at Neachley and Ruckley have dried up.
